intro: Glyptopetalum quadrangulare, commonly known as the four-sided rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, four-angled leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. It produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Glyptopetalum quadrangulare is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
